ConnectDirectory.documentation: Creates an AD Connector to connect an on-premises directory.

CreateAlias.documentation:
Creates an alias for a directory and assigns the alias to the directory. The alias is used to construct the access URL for the directory, such as ``http://alias.awsapps.com``.

  After an alias has been created, it cannot be deleted or reused, so this operation should only be used when absolutely necessary.

CreateComputer.documentation: Creates a computer account in the specified directory, and joins the computer to the directory.

CreateSnapshot.documentation:
Creates a snapshot of an existing directory.

 You cannot take snapshots of extended or connected directories.

DeleteDirectory.documentation: Deletes an AWS Directory Service directory.

DescribeDirectories.documentation:
Obtains information about the directories that belong to this account.

 You can retrieve information about specific directories by passing the directory identifiers in the *DirectoryIds* parameter. Otherwise, all directories that belong to the current account are returned.

 This operation supports pagination with the use of the *NextToken* request and response parameters. If more results are available, the *DescribeDirectoriesResult.NextToken* member contains a token that you pass in the next call to DescribeDirectories to retrieve the next set of items.

 You can also specify a maximum number of return results with the *Limit* parameter.

DescribeSnapshots.documentation:
Obtains information about the directory snapshots that belong to this account.

 This operation supports pagination with the use of the *NextToken* request and response parameters. If more results are available, the *DescribeSnapshots.NextToken* member contains a token that you pass in the next call to DescribeSnapshots to retrieve the next set of items.

 You can also specify a maximum number of return results with the *Limit* parameter.

DisableRadius.documentation: Disables multi-factor authentication (MFA) with Remote Authentication Dial In User Service (RADIUS) for an AD Connector directory.

DisableSso.documentation: Disables single-sign on for a directory.

EnableRadius.documentation: Enables multi-factor authentication (MFA) with Remote Authentication Dial In User Service (RADIUS) for an AD Connector directory.

EnableSso.documentation: Enables single-sign on for a directory.

GetDirectoryLimits.documentation: Obtains directory limit information for the current region.

GetSnapshotLimits.documentation: Obtains the manual snapshot limits for a directory.

RestoreFromSnapshot.documentation:
Restores a directory using an existing directory snapshot.

 When you restore a directory from a snapshot, any changes made to the directory after the snapshot date are overwritten.

 This action returns as soon as the restore operation is initiated. You can monitor the progress of the restore operation by calling the DescribeDirectories operation with the directory identifier. When the **DirectoryDescription.Stage** value changes to ``Active``, the restore operation is complete.

UpdateRadius.documentation: Updates the Remote Authentication Dial In User Service (RADIUS) server information for an AD Connector directory.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: The name of the attribute.

members.name: Value
members.documentation: The value of the attribute.

members.name: Message
members.documentation: The textual message for the exception.

members.name: RequestId
members.documentation: The identifier of the request that caused the exception.

Computer.documentation: Contains information about a computer account in a directory.

members.name: ComputerId
members.documentation: The identifier of the computer.

members.name: ComputerName
members.documentation: The computer name.

members.name: ComputerAttributes
members.documentation: An array of Attribute objects that contain the LDAP attributes that belong to the computer account.

ConnectDirectoryRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the ConnectDirectory operation.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: The fully-qualified name of the on-premises directory, such as corp.example.com.

members.name: ShortName
members.documentation: The NetBIOS name of the on-premises directory, such as CORP.

members.name: Password
members.documentation: The password for the on-premises user account.

members.name: Description
members.documentation: A textual description for the directory.

members.name: Size
members.documentation: The size of the directory.

members.name: ConnectSettings
members.documentation: A DirectoryConnectSettings object that contains additional information for the operation.

ConnectDirectoryResult.documentation: Contains the results of the ConnectDirectory operation.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The identifier of the new directory.

CreateAliasRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the CreateAlias operation.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The identifier of the directory to create the alias for.

members.name: Alias
members.documentation:
The requested alias.

The alias must be unique amongst all aliases in AWS. This operation will throw an EntityAlreadyExistsException if this alias already exists.

CreateAliasResult.documentation: Contains the results of the CreateAlias operation.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The identifier of the directory.

members.name: Alias
members.documentation: The alias for the directory.

CreateComputerRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the CreateComputer operation.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The identifier of the directory to create the computer account in.

members.name: ComputerName
members.documentation: The name of the computer account.

members.name: Password
members.documentation: A one-time password that is used to join the computer to the directory. You should generate a random, strong password to use for this parameter.

members.name: OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedName
members.documentation: The fully-qualified distinguished name of the organizational unit to place the computer account in.

members.name: ComputerAttributes
members.documentation: An array of Attribute objects that contain any LDAP attributes to apply to the computer account.

CreateComputerResult.documentation: Contains the results for the CreateComputer operation.

members.name: Computer
members.documentation: A Computer object the represents the computer account.

CreateDirectoryRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the CreateDirectory operation.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: The fully qualified name for the directory, such as corp.example.com.

members.name: ShortName
members.documentation: The short name of the directory, such as CORP.

members.name: Password
members.documentation: The password for the directory administrator. The directory creation process creates a directory administrator account with the username Administrator and this password.

members.name: Description
members.documentation: A textual description for the directory.

members.name: Size
members.documentation: The size of the directory.

members.name: VpcSettings
members.documentation: A DirectoryVpcSettings object that contains additional information for the operation.

CreateDirectoryResult.documentation: Contains the results of the CreateDirectory operation.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The identifier of the directory that was created.

CreateSnapshotRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the CreateSnapshot operation.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The identifier of the directory to take a snapshot of.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: The descriptive name to apply to the snapshot.

CreateSnapshotResult.documentation: Contains the results of the CreateSnapshot operation.

members.name: SnapshotId
members.documentation: The identifier of the snapshot that was created.

DeleteDirectoryRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the DeleteDirectory operation.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The identifier of the directory to delete.

DeleteDirectoryResult.documentation: Contains the results of the DeleteDirectory operation.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The directory identifier.

DeleteSnapshotRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the DeleteSnapshot operation.

members.name: SnapshotId
members.documentation: The identifier of the directory snapshot to be deleted.

DeleteSnapshotResult.documentation: Contains the results of the DeleteSnapshot operation.

members.name: SnapshotId
members.documentation: The identifier of the directory snapshot that was deleted.

DescribeDirectoriesRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the DescribeDirectories operation.

members.name: DirectoryIds
members.documentation:
A list of identifiers of the directories to obtain the information for. If this member is null, all directories that belong to the current account are returned.

An empty list results in an InvalidParameterException being thrown.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: The DescribeDirectoriesResult.NextToken value from a previous call to DescribeDirectories. Pass null if this is the first call.

members.name: Limit
members.documentation: The maximum number of items to return. If this value is zero, the maximum number of items is specified by the limitations of the operation.

DescribeDirectoriesResult.documentation: Contains the results of the DescribeDirectories operation.

members.name: DirectoryDescriptions
members.documentation:
The list of DirectoryDescription objects that were retrieved.

It is possible that this list contains less than the number of items specified in the Limit member of the request. This occurs if there are less than the requested number of items left to retrieve, or if the limitations of the operation have been exceeded.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: If not null, more results are available. Pass this value for the NextToken parameter in a subsequent call to DescribeDirectories to retrieve the next set of items.

DescribeSnapshotsRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the DescribeSnapshots operation.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The identifier of the directory to retrieve snapshot information for.

members.name: SnapshotIds
members.documentation: A list of identifiers of the snapshots to obtain the information for. If this member is null or empty, all snapshots are returned using the Limit and NextToken members.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: The DescribeSnapshotsResult.NextToken value from a previous call to DescribeSnapshots. Pass null if this is the first call.

members.name: Limit
members.documentation: The maximum number of objects to return.

DescribeSnapshotsResult.documentation: Contains the results of the DescribeSnapshots operation.

members.name: Snapshots
members.documentation:
The list of Snapshot objects that were retrieved.

It is possible that this list contains less than the number of items specified in the Limit member of the request. This occurs if there are less than the requested number of items left to retrieve, or if the limitations of the operation have been exceeded.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: If not null, more results are available. Pass this value in the NextToken member of a subsequent call to DescribeSnapshots.

DirectoryConnectSettings.documentation: Contains information for the ConnectDirectory operation when an AD Connector directory is being created.

members.name: VpcId
members.documentation: The identifier of the VPC that the AD Connector is created in.

members.name: SubnetIds
members.documentation: A list of subnet identifiers in the VPC that the AD Connector is created in.

members.name: CustomerDnsIps
members.documentation: A list of one or more IP addresses of DNS servers or domain controllers in the on-premises directory.

members.name: CustomerUserName
members.documentation:
The username of an account in the on-premises directory that is used to connect to the directory. This account must have the following privileges:

  • Read users and groups
  • Create computer objects
  • Join computers to the domain

DirectoryConnectSettingsDescription.documentation: Contains information about an AD Connector directory.

members.name: VpcId
members.documentation: The identifier of the VPC that the AD Connector is in.

members.name: SubnetIds
members.documentation: A list of subnet identifiers in the VPC that the AD connector is in.

members.name: CustomerUserName
members.documentation: The username of the service account in the on-premises directory.

members.name: SecurityGroupId
members.documentation: The security group identifier for the AD Connector directory.

members.name: AvailabilityZones
members.documentation: A list of the Availability Zones that the directory is in.

members.name: ConnectIps
members.documentation: The IP addresses of the AD Connector servers.

DirectoryDescription.documentation: Contains information about an AWS Directory Service directory.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The directory identifier.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: The fully-qualified name of the directory.

members.name: ShortName
members.documentation: The short name of the directory.

members.name: Size
members.documentation: The directory size.

members.name: Alias
members.documentation: The alias for the directory.

members.name: AccessUrl
members.documentation: The access URL for the directory, such as http://<alias>.awsapps.com.

members.name: Description
members.documentation: The textual description for the directory.

members.name: DnsIpAddrs
members.documentation: The IP addresses of the DNS servers for the directory. For a Simple AD directory, these are the IP addresses of the Simple AD directory servers. For an AD Connector directory, these are the IP addresses of the DNS servers or domain controllers in the on-premises directory that the AD Connector is connected to.

members.name: Stage
members.documentation: The current stage of the directory.

members.name: LaunchTime
members.documentation: Specifies when the directory was created.

members.name: StageLastUpdatedDateTime
members.documentation: The date and time that the stage was last updated.

members.name: Type
members.documentation: The directory size.

members.name: VpcSettings
members.documentation: A DirectoryVpcSettingsDescription object that contains additional information about a Simple AD directory. This member is only present if the directory is a Simple AD directory.

members.name: ConnectSettings
members.documentation: A DirectoryConnectSettingsDescription object that contains additional information about an AD Connector directory. This member is only present if the directory is an AD Connector directory.

members.name: RadiusSettings
members.documentation: A RadiusSettings object that contains information about the RADIUS server configured for this directory.

members.name: RadiusStatus
members.documentation: The status of the RADIUS MFA server connection.

members.name: StageReason
members.documentation: Additional information about the directory stage.

members.name: SsoEnabled
members.documentation: Indicates if single-sign on is enabled for the directory. For more information, see EnableSso and DisableSso.

DirectoryLimitExceededException.documentation: The maximum number of directories in the region has been reached. You can use the GetDirectoryLimits operation to determine your directory limits in the region.

DirectoryLimits.documentation: Contains directory limit information for a region.

members.name: CloudOnlyDirectoriesLimit
members.documentation: The maximum number of cloud directories allowed in the region.

members.name: CloudOnlyDirectoriesCurrentCount
members.documentation: The current number of cloud directories in the region.

members.name: CloudOnlyDirectoriesLimitReached
members.documentation: Indicates if the cloud directory limit has been reached.

members.name: ConnectedDirectoriesLimit
members.documentation: The maximum number of connected directories allowed in the region.

members.name: ConnectedDirectoriesCurrentCount
members.documentation: The current number of connected directories in the region.

members.name: ConnectedDirectoriesLimitReached
members.documentation: Indicates if the connected directory limit has been reached.

DirectoryUnavailableException.documentation: The specified directory is unavailable or could not be found.

DirectoryVpcSettings.documentation: Contains information for the CreateDirectory operation when a Simple AD directory is being created.

members.name: VpcId
members.documentation: The identifier of the VPC to create the Simple AD directory in.

members.name: SubnetIds
members.documentation: The identifiers of the subnets for the directory servers. The two subnets must be in different Availability Zones. AWS Directory Service creates a directory server and a DNS server in each of these subnets.

DirectoryVpcSettingsDescription.documentation: Contains information about a Simple AD directory.

members.name: VpcId
members.documentation: The identifier of the VPC that the directory is in.

members.name: SubnetIds
members.documentation: The identifiers of the subnets for the directory servers.

members.name: SecurityGroupId
members.documentation: The security group identifier for the directory.

members.name: AvailabilityZones
members.documentation: The list of Availability Zones that the directory is in.

DisableRadiusRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the DisableRadius operation.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The identifier of the directory to disable MFA for.

DisableRadiusResult.documentation: Contains the results of the DisableRadius operation.

DisableSsoRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the DisableSso operation.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The identifier of the directory to disable single-sign on for.

members.name: UserName
members.documentation:
The username of an alternate account to use to disable single-sign on. This is only used for AD Connector directories. This account must have privileges to remove a service principle name.

If the AD Connector service account does not have privileges to remove a service principle name, you can specify an alternate account with the UserName and Password parameters. These credentials are only used to disable single sign-on and are not stored by the service. The AD Connector service account is not changed.

members.name: Password
members.documentation: The password of an alternate account to use to disable single-sign on. This is only used for AD Connector directories. See the UserName parameter for more information.

DisableSsoResult.documentation: Contains the results of the DisableSso operation.

EnableRadiusRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the EnableRadius operation.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The identifier of the directory to enable MFA for.

members.name: RadiusSettings
members.documentation: A RadiusSettings object that contains information about the RADIUS server.

EnableRadiusResult.documentation: Contains the results of the EnableRadius operation.

EnableSsoRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the EnableSso operation.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The identifier of the directory to enable single-sign on for.

members.name: UserName
members.documentation:
The username of an alternate account to use to enable single-sign on. This is only used for AD Connector directories. This account must have privileges to add a service principle name.

If the AD Connector service account does not have privileges to add a service principle name, you can specify an alternate account with the UserName and Password parameters. These credentials are only used to enable single sign-on and are not stored by the service. The AD Connector service account is not changed.

members.name: Password
members.documentation: The password of an alternate account to use to enable single-sign on. This is only used for AD Connector directories. See the UserName parameter for more information.

EnableSsoResult.documentation: Contains the results of the EnableSso operation.

EntityDoesNotExistException.documentation: The specified entity could not be found.

ExceptionMessage.documentation: The descriptive message for the exception.

GetDirectoryLimitsRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the GetDirectoryLimits operation.

GetDirectoryLimitsResult.documentation: Contains the results of the GetDirectoryLimits operation.

members.name: DirectoryLimits
members.documentation: A DirectoryLimits object that contains the directory limits for the current region.

GetSnapshotLimitsRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the GetSnapshotLimits operation.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: Contains the identifier of the directory to obtain the limits for.

GetSnapshotLimitsResult.documentation: Contains the results of the GetSnapshotLimits operation.

members.name: SnapshotLimits
members.documentation: A SnapshotLimits object that contains the manual snapshot limits for the specified directory.

InsufficientPermissionsException.documentation: The account does not have sufficient permission to perform the operation.

InvalidParameterException.documentation: One or more parameters are not valid.

RadiusSettings.documentation: Contains information about a Remote Authentication Dial In User Service (RADIUS) server.

members.name: RadiusServers
members.documentation: An array of strings that contains the IP addresses of the RADIUS server endpoints, or the IP addresses of your RADIUS server load balancer.

members.name: RadiusPort
members.documentation: The port that your RADIUS server is using for communications. Your on-premises network must allow inbound traffic over this port from the AWS Directory Service servers.

members.name: RadiusTimeout
members.documentation: The amount of time, in seconds, to wait for the RADIUS server to respond.

members.name: RadiusRetries
members.documentation: The maximum number of times that communication with the RADIUS server is attempted.

members.name: SharedSecret
members.documentation: The shared secret code that was specified when your RADIUS endpoints were created.

members.name: AuthenticationProtocol
members.documentation: The protocol specified for your RADIUS endpoints.

members.name: DisplayLabel
members.documentation: Not currently used.

members.name: UseSameUsername
members.documentation: Not currently used.

RestoreFromSnapshotRequest.documentation: An object representing the inputs for the RestoreFromSnapshot operation.

members.name: SnapshotId
members.documentation: The identifier of the snapshot to restore from.

RestoreFromSnapshotResult.documentation: Contains the results of the RestoreFromSnapshot operation.

ServiceException.documentation: An exception has occurred in AWS Directory Service.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The directory identifier.

members.name: SnapshotId
members.documentation: The snapshot identifier.

members.name: Type
members.documentation: The snapshot type.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: The descriptive name of the snapshot.

members.name: Status
members.documentation: The snapshot status.

members.name: StartTime
members.documentation: The date and time that the snapshot was taken.

SnapshotIds.documentation: A list of directory snapshot identifiers.

SnapshotLimitExceededException.documentation: The maximum number of manual snapshots for the directory has been reached. You can use the GetSnapshotLimits operation to determine the snapshot limits for a directory.

SnapshotLimits.documentation: Contains manual snapshot limit information for a directory.

members.name: ManualSnapshotsLimit
members.documentation: The maximum number of manual snapshots allowed.

members.name: ManualSnapshotsCurrentCount
members.documentation: The current number of manual snapshots of the directory.

members.name: ManualSnapshotsLimitReached
members.documentation: Indicates if the manual snapshot limit has been reached.

Snapshots.documentation: A list of descriptions of directory snapshots.

UpdateRadiusRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the UpdateRadius operation.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The identifier of the directory to update the RADIUS server information for.

members.name: RadiusSettings
members.documentation: A RadiusSettings object that contains information about the RADIUS server.

UpdateRadiusResult.documentation: Contains the results of the UpdateRadius operation.
